p:
Fortunately, infants and children have rarely been involved in the recent COVID‐19 outbreak. A systemic review of the literature showed that children accounts for 1 to 5% of diagnosed COVID‐19 cases.
49 In the United States, 1.7% of the reported COVID‐19 cases were under 18 years old; while in Mainland China and Italy, 1.3% of the reported COVID‐19 cases were less than 19 years old.
50 ,
51 ,
52 Contact and travel history are common, in a case series of 28 confirmed pediatric patients in China, all were either family clusters or had a close contact history.
53 The first reported pediatric case in Hong Kong was an imported case with a 16‐year‐old boy returning from the Diamond Princess Cruise.
